intro: Pleiotaxis antunesii, commonly known as the Antunes' pleiotaxis, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including its succulent stems and clustered leaves. The plant exhibits a low-growing habit, often forming dense mats on rocky or arid soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pleiotaxis antunesii is considered a species of conservation concern.
